locutie.beschrijving: The preacher contrasts modern 'DIY' spirituality with the historical, particular revelation of God in the Exodus and the Cross.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High; focuses on the 'Ancient Credo' and the 'scandal of particularity'.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God as a historical actor to counter cultural subjectivism.
voorbeelden: God is the One who brought Israel up out of the land of Egypt.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To shift the hearer from a self-made deity to the biblical God; to provide comfort in 'Egypt' moments.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the Spirit is not explicitly invoked as the agent of the word's power.

voorbeelden: The God of the Bible... comes to us with a power that is not our own.
Know therefore this day, and lay it to your heart.
I expect many of you have seen Gladiator.
He has bound himself unconditionally... to you and me.
He gives us his very self.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological content but often framed in the 3rd person (talking about the promise).

declaratieven.autoriteit: Low; the preacher describes God's declarations rather than performing them (e.g., 'You are forgiven').

indicatoren: Extensive use of cultural commentary (Gladiator, NYT, WSJ).
Describing God's attributes in the 3rd person.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed about the 'scandal of particularity' but may remain an observer of the history.

missende_elementen: Direct 2nd person promise ('I promise you in His name')

voorbeelden: He has bound himself unconditionally... to you and me.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Anecdotal and homiletical guidance ('I saw', 'I expect').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation ('Is that true for you?').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the text, but rarely for direct sacramental declaration.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode; talking about God, Israel, and culture.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' atmosphere where God is the object of study.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Not moralistic; the preacher avoids simple Assertive -> Directive.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from cultural critique (Assertive) to the Credo (Commissive) to the Cross.
voorbeelden: God is the one who acts... He gives us his very self.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because he loved your fathers... know therefore this day.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is an excellent piece of 'teaching about' the nature of God, but it functions more as a lecture on biblical theology than a sacramental event.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: God is not generic. God is not all-purpose.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lengthy discussion of Gladiator and WSJ articles.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the encounter with the Word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon talks about the 'event' of the Exodus and the Cross, but rarely becomes an event in the 'here and now' through performative speech.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher remains a witness to the truth rather than a mandatory of the promise.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as the one who spoke to Moses, but the preacher does not speak 'for' God in the first person.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as an expert witness/teacher.
tekstueel_bewijs: The word of faith which we preach

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low; the Spirit is not mentioned.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's heart.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is treated as a 'reminder' of the Credo rather than a 'means' of the Exodus power.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Limited to the quotes of Scripture.
tekstueel_bewijs: The God who is present in the Word and Sacraments

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'says' (Assertives); too few 'I promise' or 'He delivers you' (Commissives/Declaratives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God is the One who brought Israel up out of the land of Egypt.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The God who brought Israel out of Egypt is here now to bring YOU out of your bondage.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from historical fact to present address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in 3rd person descriptions.
voorbeeldzinnen: I promise you today: the God of Abraham has bound Himself to you.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Increase direct 'You' address in the final third.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, who are in Egypt today, hear this...

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good, just too descriptive.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A very strong theological foundation that needs more 'fire' in its illocutionary delivery to move from a lecture to an event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT reveals that the preacher isn't just 'sending info' but failing to 'perform' the promise.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The issue isn't the lack of metaphors (Gladiator is a good one), but the lack of illocutionary force.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: Identifies that the 'scandal of particularity' is being talked about rather than being enacted.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Constative Surplus' where the preacher is so concerned with correcting cultural errors that the actual 'Proclamation' (Kerygma) becomes a secondary description.
